Godfri: Ne planiram da držim lekcije srpskim liderima

02 Nov 2019, 22:00

Novoimenovani američki ambasador u Srbiji Entoni Godfri izjavio je da ne planira da srpskim liderima drži lekcije već da se nada otvorenom dijalogu, a poručio je da se američki stav o Kosovu nije promenio i da SAD žele sporazum Beograda i Prištine koji se "u idealnim okolnostima" zasniva na uzajamnom priznavanju."Ne planiram da sa srpskim liderima imam pristup kao da ću da im držim lekcije. Nadam se otvorenom dijalogu, a kada bude potrebno da im kažem nezgodne stvari, reći ću ih direktno, u privatnim razgovorima, koliko god je to moguće, jer je na taj način diplomatski rad najefikasniji", rekao je Godfri za izdanje Politike od nedelje.Govoreći o stavovima američkih izaslanika za Zapadni Balkan Metjua Palmera kao i za dijalog Beograda i Prištine Ričarda Grelena, on je naveo da obojica traže ponovno uspostavljanje dijaloga, ohrabruju i kako je izrazio nadu, pomažu Prištini i Beogradu da zajedno dodju do rešenja od kojeg će obe strane imati korist."Nešto što će biti dogovoreno na lokalu i što će trajati dugo jer je to važno za regionalnu stabilnost", rekao je Godfri.Na pitanje da li je za Vašington ideja o prekrajanju granica uopšte na stolu i da li misli na priznanje nezavisnosti on je rekao da je važno da se dodje do suštinskih razgovora."Ovde bih morao da citiram Metjua Palmera koji kaže da o ovom pitanju nema crvenih linija niti blanko podrške. To je dobar način da se objasni kako Vašington pristupa ovom pitanju. Nećemo da definišemo način na koji dve strane, Beograd i Priština, treba da dodju do rešenja", rekao je Godfri.On je dodao da je važno je da dodje do suštinskih razgovora Prištine i Beograda i da se treba rešiti svih mogućih prepreka kako bi se došlo do održivog rešenja koje bi doprinelo stabilnosti i prosperitetu regiona.Prema njegovim rečima, "takse, kampanja povlačenja priznanja nezavisnosti, sve su to važni izazovi".

Godfrey: I do not plan to give lessons to Serbian leaders

02 Nov 2019, 22:00

Newly-appointed US ambassador to Serbia Anthony Godfrey says he does not plan to give Serbian leaders lessons but hopes for open dialogue, and said the US stance on Kosovo has not changed and that the US wants an agreement between Belgrade and Pristina "ideally" "I do not plan to have access to the Serbian leaders as if I will give them lessons. I hope for open dialogue, and when I need to tell them difficult things, I will say them directly, in private conversations, as much as it is possible, because diplomatic work is most effective in this way, "Godfrey told the Political Weekly. Talking about US views on the Western Balkans by Matthew Palmer and on the dialogue between Belgrade and Pristina, Richard Grellen, he said they were both seeking a resumption of dialogue. , encouraging, and as he expressed hope, helping Pristina and Belgrade work together to find a solution that will benefit both sides. " go to the local agreement and that will take a long time because it is important for regional stability, "Godfrey said. Asked if Washington had the idea of crossing borders at all on the table and whether he meant recognition of independence, he said it was important that there is a substantial conversation going on. "I would have to quote Matthew Palmer here saying that there are no red lines or blank support on this issue. That's a good way to explain how Washington approaches this issue. We will not define how the two sides, Belgrade and Pristina, should come to a solution, "Godfrey said. He added that it was important to reach the essential talks between Pristina and Belgrade and that all possible obstacles should be addressed in order to a viable solution has been found that would contribute to the stability and prosperity of the region.
